FuncDef:
The set service-mode card-bandwidth-mode command sets an interface bandwidth allocation mode.
The undo set service-mode card-bandwidth-mode command restores the default interface bandwidth allocation mode.
By default, the interface bandwidth allocation mode is pos-8x622M-mode.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an interface bandwidth allocation mode.
The value is a string of characters. Available options are as follows:pos-8x622M-mode: 8 valid interfaces, with 622M bandwidth on each of the interfacespos-8x155M-mode: 8 valid interfaces, with 155M bandwidth on each of the interfacespos-4x2.5G-mode: 4 valid interfaces, with 2.5G bandwidth on each of the interfaces

Examples: Warning: This command will change service-mode, causing service interruptions and configuration will be cleared. Please exercise caution when running this command. Continue? [Y/N]:
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
CR5D00E8GF72 subcard supports the following interface bandwidth allocation modes:
pos-8x622M-mode: 8 valid interfaces, with 622M bandwidth on each of the interfacespos-8x155M-mode: 8 valid interfaces, with 155M bandwidth on each of the interfacespos-4x2.5G-mode: 4 valid interfaces, with 2.5G bandwidth on each of the interfaces
To switch between these modes, run the set service-mode card-bandwidth-mode command.

Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
Switching the port bandwidth allocation mode will cause service interruptions and configuration deletion on non-auto-sensing ports. Therefore, exercise caution before switching the port bandwidth allocation mode.
